description:
Quoting markmc - autorebase should "die in a fire".

The current behavior of git review to autorebase by default can cause some spectacular breakage in the gerrit review system. This was experienced when I accidentally auto-rebased some of vish's patches, and turned them private because I was testing the process as a draft.

The general IRC statement is that autorebasing is something that we should avoid, as patches that are rebased should be explicitly tested before being pushed anyway.

We can turn off autorebasing by the adding the following bit to the .gitreview in the repositories (from the man page):

Setting defaultrebase to zero will make git-review not to rebase changes by default
title: git review autorebase should 'die in a fire'
